task.title: Specific Detailed Inspection (SDI) of the Fuel Shutoff Lever Assembly

l1item.para: This task gives the procedure for a detailed in-situ inspection of the fuel shutoff lever and cable assembly within the exhaust case.
Remove the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.
Get access to the engine exhaust case end cone. Refer to the AMM.
Examine the fuel shutoff cable for proper connection to the fuel shutoff lever.
Examine the fuel shutoff cable for general condition.
Examine the fuel shutoff lever and lever support for wear and cracks. No wear or cracks permitted.
Examine the fuel shutoff lever and lever support for evidence of oil leakage, wetness and coking. No wetness, coking or other evidence of oil leaks are permitted.
Examine the rivet and bushing attaching the lever to the lever support for cracks and wear. No cracks are permitted.
Remove all tools, equipment and unnecessary items from the work area.
Install the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.
Remove the engine cowlings as necessary (Refer to the Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

warning.para: THE VOLTAGE OUTPUT OF THE IGNITION EXCITER IS SUFFICIENT TO CAUSE A LETHAL ELECTRICAL SHOCK. THE RESIDUAL VOLTAGE IN THE IGNITION EXCITER MAY BE DANGEROUSLY HIGH. MAKE SURE THE IGNITION IS SWITCHED OFF. DISCONNECT THE INPUT CONNECTOR FIRST (REFER TO THE AIRFRAME MAINTENANCE MANUAL) AND WAIT AT LEAST 10 MINUTES BEFORE FURTHER WORK IS ATTEMPTED. DISCONNECT THE IGNITER CABLES AT THE EXCITER BEFORE DISCONNECTING AT THE IGNITERS. ALWAYS USE INSULATED TOOLS TO REMOVE THE CABLE COUPLING NUTS. DO NOT TOUCH THE OUTPUT CONNECTORS OR THE COUPLING NUTS WITH BARE HANDS.

caution.para: DO NOT ALLOW THE IGNITION CABLE BRAIDING OR THE FERRULES TO ROTATE WHEN TURNING THE COUPLING NUTS.

l1item.para: Disconnect the ignition exciter input connector (Refer to the Aircraft Maintenance Manual).
Disconnect the ignition cable assembly from the inboard igniter (Ref. Task 74-20-01-000-801).
Remove the inboard igniter (Ref. Task 74-20-02-000-801).
Insert the borescope into the bypass area until the P3 cooler can be viewed.
Inspect the P3 cooler for loss of the nickel plating and corrosion, deterioration and cracks. Make sure the P3 cooler is securely installed and there is no evidence of leaks at the gaskets.
Remove the borescope.
Install the igniter (Ref. Task 74-20-02-400-801).
Connect the ignition cable assembly to the inboard igniter (Ref. Task 74-20-01-400-801).
Install the engine cowlings as necessary (Refer to the Aircraft Maintenance Manual).
This task gives the necessary procedures to do the On-wing LUI.
Not Applicable

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

l1item.para: Do the periodic inspections listed in Chapter 05-20-00 with the following additional tasks and modifications:

l2item.para: Do the engine external wash, fan washing and desalination wash (Ref. Task 71-00-00-160-801, Task 71-00-00-160-804, Task 71-00-00-160-805, Task 71-00-00-160-806 and Task 71-00-00-160-807).
Do a performance calibration run only if it was not already done within the last 6 months (Ref. Task 71-00-00-760-812).
If the engine has not had a borescope inspection in the last 6 months, borescope inspect the following areas of the engine (Ref. Task 72-00-00-290-804):

l1item.para: Not Applicable

task.title: Detailed Inspection (DET) of the LP Compressor Inlet Area

l1item.para: This task gives the procedure for the detailed inspection of the LP compressor inlet area.
Remove the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.
Inspect the fan case as follows:

l2item.para: Inspect the fan case front internal metal surface for cracks. Pay particular attention to areas that are nicked or dented. Use 10X magnification to confirm the presence of cracks. No cracks are allowed.
Inspect the fan case abradable liner as follows:

l3item.para: Discoloration (dark brown) on the fan blade path of the abradable liner, due to fan blade tip rub, is acceptable.
Inspect the blade path area for trenching or excessive wear due to fan blade tip rub.
Inspect for voids, pits, cracks, tears, gouges and inclusions.
Inspect the entire abradable liner surface for evidence of debonding, such as blisters or bulging. None permitted.
Make sure the drain hole at the bottom of the fan case is not blocked. Clear any obstruction.

l1item.para: Inspect the nose cone as follows:

l2item.para: Make sure the nose cone is securely installed.
Make sure the anti ice hole in the front of nose cone is not blocked. Clear any obstruction.
Inspect the nose cone for foreign object damage and erosion.
Inspect the nose cone for cracks. No cracks are permitted.
Inspect the nose cone for dents. If any dents are found, refer to Task 72-30-01-220-801 for disposition.

l1item.para: Inspect the fan blades as follows:

caution.para: IF FOREIGN OBJECT DAMAGE IS SUSPECTED, REFER TO UNSCHEDULED MAINTENANCE CHECKS, Task 05-50-00-210-805.

l2item.para: Inspect the fan blades for tears (Ref. Task 72-30-01-220-801) and cracks. Tears and cracks are not acceptable.
Inspect the outer 1/3 of the fan blade leading edge for erosion. If any defect is found, refer to Task 72-30-01-220-801 for disposition.
Inspect the leading edge for bends or deformation. If any defect is found, refer to Task 72-30-01-220-801 for disposition.
Inspect the fan blades for nicks and dents. If any defect is found, refer to Task 72-30-01-220-801 for disposition.

l1item.para: Remove all tools, equipment and unnecessary items from the work area.
Install the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.

graphic.title: Detailed Inspection (DET) of the LP Compressor Inlet Area

task.title: General Visual Inspection (GVI) of the LP Compressor Inlet Area

l1item.para: This task gives the procedure for the general visual inspection of the LP compressor inlet area.
Remove the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.
Inspect the inside and outside of the engine inlet area for oil leaks.
Remove all tools, equipment and unnecessary items from the work area.
Install the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.

task.title: Detailed Inspection (DET) of the Compressor Case Assembly

l1item.para: This task gives the procedure for the detailed inspection of the compressor case assembly.
Remove the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.
Make sure the compressor case is securely installed.
Make sure the AGB mount brackets are securely installed.
Inspect the compressor case for cracks on the outer surface and the front and rear flanges, the inboard and outboard engine mount pads and AGB mounts pads. No cracks are permitted.
Remove all tools, equipment and unnecessary items from the work area.
Install the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.

graphic.title: Detailed Inspection (DET) of the Compressor Case Assembly

task.title: Detailed Inspection (DET) of the Fan Case External Area

l1item.para: This task gives the procedure for the detailed inspection of the fan case external areas.
Remove the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.

Inspect the fan case front external metal surfaces for cracks. Pay particular attention to areas that are nicked or dented. Use 10X magnification to confirm the presence of cracks. No cracks are allowed.
Make sure the five bonded studs on the fan case are securely attached.
Inspect the fan exit vane retaining grommets as follows:

l2item.para: Make sure the grommets are securely installed and in good condition.
Inspect the grommets for cracks. No cracks are allowed.
Inspect the grommets for foreign object damage.
Inspect the grommets for thermal distress.

l1item.para: Inspect the fan exit vane retaining clamp as follows:

l2item.para: Make sure the clamp is securely installed and in good condition.
Inspect the clamp for cracks. No cracks are allowed.
Inspect the clamp for nicks, dents and corrosion.

l1item.para: Remove all tools, equipment and unnecessary items from the work area.
Install the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.

graphic.title: Detailed Inspection (DET) of the Fan Case External Areas

task.title: General Visual Inspection (GVI) of the Accessory Gearbox (AGB) Assembly

l1item.para: This task gives the procedure for the general visual inspection of the AGB assembly.
Remove the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.
Make sure the AGB assembly is securely installed.
Inspect the AGB housing for cracks.
Inspect the AGB housing cover for cracks.
Inspect the AGB breather tube for cracks and dents.
Inspect the starter generator mount pad for cracks.
Inspect the starter generator V clamp for cracks.
Inspect the FMU mount pad for cracks.
Inspect the filler neck and oil level indicator for cracks.
Inspect the AGB area for oil leaks.
Remove all tools, equipment and unnecessary items from the work area.
Install the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.

graphic.title: General Visual Inspection (GVI) of the AGB Assembly

task.title: General Visual Inspection (GVI) of the Bypass Duct

l1item.para: This task gives the procedure for the general visual inspection of the bypass duct.
Remove the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.
Inspect the outer surface of the bypass duct for deterioration and cracks.
Inspect the front and rear flanges for deterioration and cracks. Make sure the flange bolts are securely installed and there is no evidence of air leaks.
Inspect the outer surface of the bypass duct and the and the ignition cables for signs of contact and fretting.
Inspect the igniter fairings for corrosion, deterioration and cracks. Make sure the fairings are securely installed.
Inspect the igniter fairing grommets for exposure to excessive temperatures, deterioration and cracks. Make sure the grommets are securely installed.
Inspect the P3/oil fairings for corrosion, deterioration and cracks. Make sure the fairings are securely installed and there is no evidence of leaks at the seals.
Inspect the P3/oil fairing grommets for exposure to excessive temperatures, deterioration and cracks. Make sure the grommets are securely installed.
Inspect the fuel fairing for corrosion, deterioration and cracks. Make sure the fairing is securely installed and there is no evidence of leaks.
Inspect the fuel fairing grommet for exposure to excessive temperatures, deterioration and cracks. Make sure the grommet is securely installed.
Inspect the engine rear mount bracket for corrosion, deterioration and cracks. Make sure the flange bolts are securely installed and are not damaged.
Make sure ACOC, ignition cables, wiring harness and tubes are securely installed.
Make sure the information label is on the ACOC and you can read it.
Remove all tools, equipment and unnecessary items from the work area.
Install the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.

graphic.title: General Visual Inspection (GVI) of the Bypass Duct

task.title: General Visual Inspection (GVI) of the Turbine Exhaust Case Assembly

l1item.para: This task gives the procedure for the general visual inspection of the turbine exhaust case assembly.
Remove the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.
Make sure the turbine exhaust case end cone and the five retaining bolts are securely installed.
Inspect the turbine exhaust case end cone for cracks.
Inspect the exhaust mixer surfaces and welded areas for cracks.
Inspect the rear of the engine for oil leaks.
Remove all tools, equipment and unnecessary items from the work area.
Install the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.

graphic.title: General Visual Inspection (GVI) of the Turbine Exhaust Case Assembly

task.title: General Visual Inspection (GVI) of the Fuel Distribution System

l1item.para: This task gives the procedure for the general visual inspection of the fuel distribution system.
Remove the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.
Inspect the FMU. Refer to Task 73-20-01-212-801.
Inspect the fuel filter housing on the FOHE. Refer to Task 73-10-02-212-801.
Inspect the FOHE. Refer to Task 73-10-02-212-801.
Inspect the external fuel tubes. Refer to Task 70-00-00-200-801.
Remove all tools, equipment and unnecessary items from the work area.
Install the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.

task.title: General Visual Inspection (GVI) of the Oil Distribution System

l1item.para: This task gives the procedure for the general visual inspection of the oil distribution system.
Remove the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.

Inspect the Nos. 1 to 4 bearing, No.5 bearing, oil pump-to-ACOC and ACOC-to-FOHE external pressure oil tubes for FOD, retention, oil leaks and cracking. Refer to Task 70-00-00-200-801, Inspection of Fuel, Air and Oil Tubes.
Inspect the front (No.4 bearing) and No.5 external scavenge oil tubes for FOD, retention, oil leaks, and cracking. Refer to Task 70-00-00-200-801, Inspection of Fuel, Air and Oil Tubes.
Inspect the engine oil pump housing external surfaces and mating surfaces for FOD, retention, oil leaks and cracking.
Inspect the cold start valve mounting flange on the oil pump housing and the installed cold start valve for FOD, retention and oil leaks.
Inspect the engine oil filter cover for FOD, retention and oil leaks.
Inspect the installed engine oil filter bypass valve drain valve and mounting port in the oil pump housing for cracking, FOD, retention and oil leaks.
Inspect the MOT/MOP sensors mounting pad boss on the engine fuel-oil heat exchanger (FOHE) housing for cracking, FOD, retention and oil leaks.
Inspect the installed engine air-cooled-oil-cooler (ACOC) for FOD, retention and oil leaks.
Remove all tools, equipment and unnecessary items from the work area.
Install the engine cowlings as necessary. Refer to the AMM.
